result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L. Horvath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:21 p.m. Defendant Joseph L. Horvath in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Defendant appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. The defendant has complied with the terms of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Statement by DA Blader regarding sentencing. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights mailed to DE.

Case Called @ 11:40 AM: Defendant Joseph L. Horvath in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA - $800 payment paid up front to CSA - due to that payment State will move for amendment to Misd Level charge of FTP CSUP. Joint Agreement for 12 mos Deferred SEH Agreement.  Upon successful completion, State will recommend Court Costs only as penalty.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred SEH Agreement.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend to Misd Level FTP CSUP Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of Deferred SEH Agreement.  Matter stayed for 1 yr.  Defendant reminded that bond continues during pendency of this case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 10, 2014 at 09:50 am.
Status conference on April 30, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:53 p.m. Defendant Joseph L. Horvath in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein. Defendant appears telephonically. Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on March 25, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:09 PM: Defendant Joseph L. Horvath in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def unsure if he needs counsel today.  Not employed currently.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD on eligibility.  Back of Record at 1:45 PM: Defendant Joseph L. Horvath in court, with Atty Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD, eligibility confirmed.  Court advises Def of active warrant for FTA back in October.  Ruth Zouski appears and requests that warrant track along with criminal matter as to underlying civil matter.  Court withdraws warrant.  Statement by Defendant as to college credits.  Full enrolled at Mankato.  The Court:  Finds basis exists for contempt - 90 days WCJ imposed - Stayed - Purge:  For a period of 2 yrs w/o interruption, maintain current order of $69/wk, which includes Adm Order, payments to commence 6/1/14 - $297 per month - weekly order converted to monthly order amount.  Def's mailing address to remain the Stevens Point address.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
